metadata.title: CVE-2023-3772 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s IP framework for transformingpackets (XFRM subsystem). This issue may allow a malicious user withCAP_NET_ADMIN privileges to directly dereference a NULL pointer inxfrm_update_ae_params(), leading to a possible kernel crash and denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-88-generic - 5.15.0-88.98
linux-image-5.15.0-88-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-88.98
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-88-generic - 5.15.0-88.98
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-88-generic-64k - 5.15.0-88.98
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-88.98').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needs-triage').
